    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static ScreenManager getInstance()
        The ScreenChanger is defined as a Singleton class. This method allows creating an instance of the class only once during runtime of the application.
        Returns:
        the ScreenChanger instance

      • getStage

        public javafx.stage.Stage getStage()
        A getter for the application's parimary stage
        Returns:
        the stage of the application

      • showScreen

        public void showScreen​(java.lang.String screenName,
                       java.lang.String fxmlResource,
                       boolean showOnce,
                       boolean saveState,
                       java.lang.Object information)
                throws StatefulException,
                       ScreenException
        This method is called when a screen needs to be shown. It is pushed to the stack as the most current screen displayed, and to the map for identification purposes.
        Parameters:
        screenName - the screen's name to be shown
        fxmlResource - the fxml file name of the screen to be shown
        showOnce - true if the screen needs to be shown only once. On this case, the screen won't be pushed to the screensStack and the the screensMap.
        saveState - true if the current screen needs to save its current state, false otherwise. The screen in this case has to implement Stateful.
        information - an object that contains information for the screen, before its load
        Throws:
        StatefulException - if the saveState flag is true while the current screen does not implement Stateful
        ScreenException - if the loading of the FXML file failed

      • goToPreviousScreen

        public void goToPreviousScreen​(boolean wasShownOnce,
                               boolean restoreState)
                        throws ScreenException,
                               StatefulException
        This method is called when a "Back" button is clicked from some screen, or if a screen has finished its action and wants the previous screen to be shown. The screen who called this method is on the top of the stack, so it is removed and then the new top is displayed on the stage.
        Parameters:
        wasShownOnce - indicates if the calling screen was shown only once. Therefore, it was not in the screens stack so there is not need to pop anything
        restoreState - indicates whether the state of the previous screen needs to be restored, or the previous screen should be loaded as new screen
        Throws:
        ScreenException - if trying to access a previous screen that does not exist
        StatefulException - if the restoreState flag is true while the screen does not implement Stateful

      • addRootAndStart

        private void addRootAndStart​(javafx.scene.Parent root,
                             AbstractScreen controller)
                      throws StatefulException
        This method gets a root, a controller and shows the root on the screen
        Parameters:
        root - the fxml root
        controller - the screen's controller
        Throws:
        StatefulException - if the restoreState flag is true while the screen does not implement Stateful

      • resetScreensStack

        public void resetScreensStack()
        This method is called if the stack needs to be resetted. This can happen if an operation is fully completed, and returning to the main/account screen is required, without any other screen to go back to.

      • whoIsBefore

        public java.lang.String whoIsBefore()
        This method returns the name of the screen's controller that is befoe the current screen in the stack
        Returns:
        returns the name of the controller of the screen that is before the top of the stack
